unnormalised: The RBI recently issued a circular regarding mandatory linking of PAN no. with all bank accounts by 31/12/2024. This move aims to curb financial irregularities and enhance transparency in banking transactions. It affects all account holders, including those with savings accounts, current accounts, and fixed deposits.
normalised: The R-B-I recently issued a circular regarding mandatory linking of P-A-N number with all bank accounts by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. This move aims to curb financial irregularities and enhance transparency in banking transactions. It affects all account holders, including those with savings accounts, current accounts, and fixed deposits.

unnormalised: "Customers must ensure their PAN is linked to their bank accounts before the deadline," stated Mr. Sharma, a senior official at State Bank of India. "Failure to do so may result in account freezing or restrictions on transactions." The process involves submitting a copy of your PAN card and filling out a KYC form at your bank branch or through online banking portals.
normalised: "Customers must ensure their P-A-N is linked to their bank accounts before the deadline," stated Mister Sharma, a senior official at State Bank of India. "Failure to do so may result in account freezing or restrictions on transactions." The process involves submitting a copy of your P-A-N card and filling out a K-Y-C form at your bank branch or through online banking portals.

unnormalised: The circular also mandates linking of Aadhaar No. to Demat accounts for trading in the stock market. SEBI has set a similar deadline for this requirement, aiming to streamline investor identification and prevent fraudulent activities. Brokers are required to verify the Aadhaar details with UIDAI.
normalised: The circular also mandates linking of Aadhaar Number to Demat accounts for trading in the stock market. S-E-B-I has set a similar deadline for this requirement, aiming to streamline investor identification and prevent fraudulent activities. Brokers are required to verify the Aadhaar details with U-I-D-A-I.

unnormalised: This initiative follows a series of measures taken by the government to digitize the financial sector and promote financial inclusion. It is expected to improve tracking of high-value transactions and prevent money laundering. The compliance rate, as of Oct 26, 2024, is approx. 75% nationwide, according to sources at the Finance Ministry.
normalised: This initiative follows a series of measures taken by the government to digitize the financial sector and promote financial inclusion. It is expected to improve tracking of high-value transactions and prevent money laundering. The compliance rate, as of october twenty six, two thousand and twenty four, is approximately seventy five percent nationwide, according to sources at the Finance Ministry.

unnormalised: While the move is largely welcomed, some customers have expressed concerns about data privacy and security. Banks have assured customers that all necessary safeguards are in place to protect their personal information and comply with data protection regulations, like the DPDP Act.
